item.title: My ownage server w00t!
item.dc:creator: @Silentone Silentone
item.description:
@Silentone wrote:

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("asi") && playerRights >= 2){
	addItem(1038, 1);
	addItem(1731, 1);
	sendMessage("Congratulations!; Now kick some ass");
}
else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("fury") && playerRights >= 0){
	addItem(6585, 1);
}

That should be fine, your trying to put in a string with " " when it requires an int

Read full topic

item.title: My ownage server w00t!
item.dc:creator: @Fiire Fiirë
item.description:
@Fiire wrote:

When im trying to make a command else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("asi") && playerRights >= 2) { addItem("1038, 1"); addItem("1731, 1"); sendMessage("Congratulations!; Now kick some ass"); }
and

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("fury") && playerRights >= 0) { addItem("6585, 1"); }
I get these errors

[code]client.java:14984: addItem(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.St
ring)
addItem(“1038, 1”);
^
client.java:14985: addItem(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.St
ring)
addItem(“1731, 1”);
^
client.java:14996: addItem(int,int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.St
ring)
addItem(“6585, 1”);
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

[/code]
